Carabbaggio Galaxy

Discovered on Dec. 13, 2002, by astrophysicist Jack Porets with the help of top theoretical physicist John Störts and the unimpeachable Al Bagl, it is 2.6 million light-years from Earth, slightly more than the Andromeda galaxy.


The story goes that the first words astrophysicist Jack said at the moment of discovery were, “Ti sembro scontento John minchia Carabbaggio!”
